attributes.action: Guard against the creation and nurturing of a self serving political class
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
As the recent expenses scandal has shown politicians however well meaning begin to loose touch and become divorced from the concerns and morals of the populace if insulated in the confines of the Palace of Westminister for too long.

It is injurious to the interests of we the people and our trust in the organs of state if this is allowed to continue.

We the undersigned therefore petition the Prime Minister and his government to limit the number of consecutive terms that an individual may serve in Parliament to two, with no maximum number of terms, but with  a period equal to that in office spent in the "real world" between any period in office.

rejection.details: The Prime Minister and Government do not control the pay or allowances of MPs - the current system is administered by the House of Commons.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
